task.title: Task: Creating a Recommended Chart
task.shortdesc: Creating a chart that Excel recommends for your data.

context.p: Excel offers many kinds of different charts. Choosing the most appropriate chart can be difficult. Excel can help you with the Recommended Charts command, which produces a list of charts that Excel recommends for your data. To use this feature you should always select the data first.
As an example, a file with the quarterly sales of a bakery.

fig.title: Sales bakery per year by quarter

image.alt: Sales bakery per year by quarter

step.cmd: Select any cell in the data area A1:D5.

info.note: If the data area is a contiguous area, such as A1: D5 is here, then if you select any cell in this area Excel automatically recognizes it as the entire data area for a chart. If it's not a contiguous area you must select the whole data area.

stepresult.p: The dialog box Insert Chart is displayed. On the left side, you can scroll through the list of charts that Excel recommends for your data. And when you click on a chart, you will see a preview of the chart on the right with your data.

The chart is embedded in the worksheet and Chart Tools with the group's Design and Format, are added to the ribbon. Recommended Clustered Column Chart
Recommended clustered column chart
There is a frame around the chart because the chart is selected. And in the upper-right corner you can see three buttons for adding or changing:
Chart Elements
Chart Styles
Chart Filters

example.title: Faster way
example.p:
There is a faster way to insert a recommended chart:
Select the data, including the headings.
Click the Quick Analysis button at the bottom right corner of the selected range.
Click Charts and select the chart you want.
